attributes.action: Cancel the Advanced British Standard qualification from starting
attributes.additional_details: Some children don’t feel safe at school or some might even want to start and get a job or go to college not stay and do the advanced British standard qualification. It’s not right after doing the mandatory 11years at school they should have the choice if they want to stay on and do this at school. I’m sure many people of the ages 11-16 will support me on what I’m saying as they are tired of school and they want to be able to go get jobs after leaving school at year 11 or get an apprenticeship.
attributes.background: Don’t force secondary school children to have to stay on and do maths and English until they are 18. They should have the choice to do and learn what they want after they have done what has been the mandatory for hundreds of years

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Do not make Mathematics and English a requirement up to 18: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/647430

The Government has not announced any plans to change the school leaving age.
